data.title: How LangChain Found a Trusted Partner for Their Sandbox Needs
data.snippet:
As a leader in open‚Äësource agent development, LangChain‚Äôs bread and butter is building, orchestrating, and deploying agents seamlessly for developers and non‚Äëtechnical users alike. To advance this mission, Brace Sproul, Head of Applied AI, and his team built a cloud‚Äëhosted coding agent that runs autonomously end to end. To open-source it reliably, they needed to nail one thing: their sandbox partner. [...] #### If anybody asked me which runtime platform to use, I'm going to 100% say Daytona every time. With their SDK, we never have to worry about an agent leaking or taking actions that it shouldn't. I haven't seen this anywhere else.

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI at LangChain

###### MORE CUSTOMER STORIES

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona##### How Orchids Powers the World's First AI Full-Stack Engineer With Daytona

##### How Orchids Powers the World's First AI Full-Stack Engineer With Daytona [...] langchain.com

langchain.com

Linkedin

Linkedin

Linkedin

Learn how the leading open-source agent engineering platform partnered with Daytona to ensure secure, instant, and persistent sandboxes for their production-ready coding agent.

#### Our mission is to be the one place developers go for all their agent needs. Daytona is the only tech partner that could support our sandbox needs and make this possible.

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI at LangChain

###### 01 -- CHALLENGE

### Deploying Open-Source Coding Agents Called for a Reliable Sandbox Infrastructure Partner

data.snippet:
# BRACE SPROUL

HEAD OF APPLIED AI @ LANGCHAIN

AI/ML Engineer heading LangChain's Applied AI team. Interested in agents, drones, and rockets.

## EXPERIENCE

San Francisco

Head of Applied AI

March 2025 - Present

Applied AI Engineer

October 2023 - March 2025

San Francisco

Tech Lead | Full Stack Engineer

October 2022 - October 2023

Core team member developing Create's code generation AI agent using OpenAI's GPT via LangChain.

Working across a full TypeScript stack, building various features and products, including code generation using LLMs, infrastructure and database architecture, along with web apps.

### Linear IO Services

Remote

Full Stack Engineer Contract

September 2022 - January 2023 [...] ### CONNECT

¬© 2025 BRACE SPROUL. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. [...] ### LangGraph.js

Framework to build resilient language agents as graphs. The TypeScript implementation of LangGraph.

### FULLSTACK AI APPS/AGENTS

### Open Canvas

A better UX for chat, writing content, and coding with LLMs.

### Agent Inbox

An inbox UX for interacting with human-in-the-loop agents.

### Agent Chat UI

Web app for interacting with any LangGraph agent (PY & TS) via a chat interface.

### Social Media Agent

An agent for sourcing, curating, and scheduling social media posts with human-in-the-loop.

### MORE OPEN SOURCE PROJECTS

Check out my curated list of awesome LangGraph.js projects, tutorials, and resources. This repository contains a full list of open source AI projects, YouTube videos, and other resources for learning about and building with LangGraph.js.

# Josh Coyne‚Äôs Post

Josh Coyne

 Report this post

If you're a founder and looking for an effusive reaction to your new AI product, you know who to call... In all seriousness, congrats Brace Sproul & the LangChain team on an epic new product launch!

LangChain

482,296 followers

LangSmith Agent Builder is generally available üéâ It‚Äôs surprisingly easy to build agents now. Most work automation tools make you configure every step. As soon as the job evolves, you spend hours remapping and debugging the workflow. We took a different approach: ‚úÖ You build using everyday language. ‚úÖ It gets better by using memory to learn from your feedback. ‚úÖ You stop babysitting if/then workflows. Even a VC can do it‚Ä¶üëá Try Agent Builder free:  Read the announcement:

data.title: RC Sproul JrRC Sproul Jr | Grateful husband of Lisa, sinner saved ...
data.snippet:
‚ÄúWhat about a biblical view of profits? he continued. ‚ÄúYes, I could do that.‚Äù ‚ÄúHow about caring for the poor? Could you write one on that?‚Äù I was terribly puzzled by this point. Hesitantly I responded, ‚ÄúI suppose if I had enough time I could.‚Äù ‚ÄúDo you think you could do ten such papers?‚Äù ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù ‚ÄúWell if you did, then you‚Äôd have a book. That‚Äôs what I think you should do this summer as your job. When you are done I‚Äôll go through it and then we‚Äôll find a publisher.‚Äù

That book, Money Matters, with various updates, retitles (it‚Äôs now called Biblical Economics) and revisions, under various publishers, has been in print just under forty years. And that is how one gifted and accomplished author got an uncertain teenager to write his first book. [...] Trouble is, of course, that resting in the work of Christ for you, repenting and believing, isn‚Äôt the same thing as pushing button A rather than button B. It requires, you know, actually repenting and believing. Still, many hoped that given Mr. Adam‚Äôs admittedly weak biblical training, that maybe there was reason to hope. When a dog can play checkers, it is silly to criticize his strategy.  
This is what he wrote: [...] I love writing. Which is why I love helping others to do the same. Five years ago I started The Purpose Driven Write. My purpose is to help writers get their writing polished brilliant enough to earn and find an audience. I‚Äôve been blessed to do everything from taking others‚Äô ideas and putting them in book form to laying out the broad outline to actual coaching writing to substantive editing to buffing a final draft to a sparkling sheen.
